pr_title: Implement recipe converter from common file contract.

timeline.message: implement recipe converter with updated artifact

timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: This is the jackson annotation for using Builder’s method to deserialize. Jackson uses the withPrefix to identify what builder methods to call when deserialize. If not set, the default prefix is “with”, but we used lombok’s @builder and didn’t specify a prefix, that’s why withPrefix="" (Which I know looks almost like a hack or something. 😆 )
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: Yes. Long story short, before M2, nested structure will be supported with JSON String so the type will be "STRING". Afterwards, we will revisit to probably remove this type from the recipe syntax perspective and switch to use a separate JSON/YAML schema file for validation (current favorable direction). But it can change depending on the actual design decision.
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: I think there's one in util
timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: Right. That one could be removed after we migrated.
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: Do we keep these models along with common/* ?
timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText:
Yes. Note the common/* is temporarily copied from Brazil pkg EvergreenComponentCommon. It will be removed after maven dependency is setup. For why we are not using it directly across our codebase, the main reason is that we don't want to tie our core models to the recipe file contract. The maintainability benefit wins over the cost of "duplicating" it.
See detailed comparison and the winner from the this doc
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: Does platformSpecificManifest only have details of the resolved platform?
timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: The object type holds one platform's manifest, which may be multiple instances in a recipe file. But it resolved to the best match when loading to our PackageRecipe.
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: Is this a placeholder that in the future the POJO field name might be different than json field name?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: I'd need @wikimonkey 's help as he implemented in the Brazil side.
replies.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: I guess eventually we'll need to seek for tools to auto generate these pojo (like swagger ) in the common model. This LGTM for now
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: Manually declaring builder class PlatformSpecificManifestBuilder is purely for annotation purpose so Jackson can use generated builder to deserialize. @JsonPOJOBuilder recognized default prefix is with.
replies.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: @ShirleyZheng92 Correct! That's where we want to get to!
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: Because it's from the file contract of recipe. I hesitated when naming it... Looking for a better name. Didn't like convertXyzFromRecipe or convertXyzFromCommonModel...
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: Curious, why not use the existing PackageParameter and ComponentArtifact class?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText:
See: #382 (comment).
They are very similar now, but they could change at different time for different reasons.
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: which part should be moved to common model?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: I guess Ethan means deserialization part. Then common model needs to define exception(s) as well.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: Why isn't it final? Also is the class singleton?
timeline.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: It was static utils before but I added an instance method and used it with our DI. Removed final so that I can easily mock it in tests. It's singleton.
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: Can you proceed if no match? Should it throw exception here?
timeline.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: Hmm. I thought we could probably be able to... In this case it's find, the recipe file may exist but can't be used for this platform, so we just log a warn and then go to another usable version, etc. But we can refine it later.
replies.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: The situation is not supposed to happen in cloud interaction because cloud is supposed to resolve to a platform compatible one, but it could happen in local dev - developer uses a recipe that no applicable platform config, in such case, I think deployment should fail fast. We can refactor this when we do DR overhaul.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we rename it to 'component...'? The name probably should avoid conflicting with file model
timeline.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: Yes. I will do them in one shot after we cleaned things up.
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: nit: probably it will never happen, but can we ensure no null element in the result list by doing a filter?
timeline.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: Great suggestion. I added filter nonnull before doing map and removed the null check in the convertX method. Cleaner!
replies.author: leaf94
